name: Manipur
funFacts: Home to the world's only floating national park.

description_section.title: Welcome to Manipur
description_section.content: Manipur is a mosaic of ancient traditions and breathtaking landscapes. Known as the 'Jewel of India', it offers a unique blend of valley culture and hill tribe heritage.

land_and_memory.title: Land & Memory
land_and_memory.content: Manipur is defined by the phumdis of Loktak Lake and the rolling green hills. It is a land where history is whispered in the winds of the Kangla Fort and sung in the ballads of Khongjom.

defining_themes.title: Floating Wetlands
defining_themes.description: The unique ecosystem of Loktak Lake.

defining_themes.title: Meitei Culture
defining_themes.description: Rich classical dance and martial arts traditions.

contributions.title: Origin of Polo
contributions.description: Sagol Kangjei, the indigenous form of polo, started here.

contributions.title: Moirang Phee
contributions.description: Distinctive temple border designs woven by women.

ways_to_experience.title: Lake Boating
ways_to_experience.description: Navigate the floating islands of Loktak.

ways_to_experience.title: Temple Trails
ways_to_experience.description: Visit the Govindaji Temple and historical sites.

name: Meghalaya
funFacts: Home to the wettest place on Earth, Mawsynram.
Famous for living root bridges bio-engineered by locals.

description_section.title: Welcome to Meghalaya
description_section.content: Meghalaya, the 'Abode of Clouds', is a mesmerizing tapestry of misty hills, cascading waterfalls, and ancient root bridges.

land_and_memory.title: Land & Memory
land_and_memory.content: Walk through the sacred groves where ancestors whisper in the rustling leaves. The living root bridges stand as a testament to a deep, symbiotic bond with nature.

defining_themes.title: Living Architecture
defining_themes.description: Bridges grown from rubber tree roots.

defining_themes.title: Cascading Falls
defining_themes.description: Land of a thousand waterfalls like Nohkalikai.

contributions.title: Rock Capital
contributions.description: Shillong is known as India's Rock Capital.

ways_to_experience.title: Caving & Trekking
ways_to_experience.description: Explore some of South Asia's longest caves.

essentials_summary.permit_name: None for Indian Tourists (Registration for Foreigners)

name: Assam
funFacts: Known for Assam Tea and One-Horned Rhinos.
Majuli is the world's largest river island.

description_section.title: Welcome to Assam
description_section.content: The gateway to the Northeast, Assam is blessed with the mighty Brahmaputra river, lush tea gardens, and rich diverse wildlife.

land_and_memory.title: Land & Memory
land_and_memory.content: From the Ahom Kingdom that ruled for 600 years to the vibrant Bihu beats, Assam is a land where tradition flows as perennially as the Red River.

defining_themes.title: Tea Gardens
defining_themes.description: Endless waves of green tea bushes.

contributions.title: Assam Tea
contributions.description: Produces some of the world's finest strong teas.

ways_to_experience.title: Safari
ways_to_experience.description: Jeep safari in Kaziranga National Park.

name: Arunachal Pradesh
funFacts: The first Indian soil to greet the rising sun.
Home to over 26 major tribes and 100 sub-tribes.

description_section.title: Welcome to Arunachal Pradesh
description_section.content: A spiritual and adventurous frontier, Arunachal offers snow-capped peaks, ancient monasteries, and untouched biodiversity.

land_and_memory.title: Land & Memory
land_and_memory.content: Where the chant of monks meets the roar of the Siang river. It is a land of hidden valleys and ancient wisdom.

contributions.title: Biodiversity
contributions.description: One of the world's 18 biodiversity hotspots.

ways_to_experience.title: Ziro Festival
ways_to_experience.description: Attend the famous music festival in Ziro Valley.

name: Nagaland
funFacts: Known for the fierce warrior traditions of the past.

description_section.title: Welcome to Nagaland
description_section.content: Vibrant, raw, and deeply cultural. Nagaland is a place where every month has a festival and every tribe has a unique story.

land_and_memory.title: Land & Memory
land_and_memory.content: From the Battle of Kohima to the vibrant Hornbill gatherings, Nagaland carries the legacy of warriors and the spirit of community.

defining_themes.title: WWII History
defining_themes.description: Kohima War Cemetery is a significant landmark.

contributions.title: Tribal Unity
contributions.description: 16 major tribes showcasing unity in diversity.

ways_to_experience.title: Naga Cuisine
ways_to_experience.description: Taste the famous Raja Mircha (King Chilli).

name: Mizoram
funFacts: Chapchar Kut is the most important festival.

description_section.title: Welcome to Mizoram
description_section.content: Peaceful, scenic, and disciplined. Mizoram offers endless blue hills and a unique culture of extensive hospitality.

land_and_memory.title: Land & Memory
land_and_memory.content: Meaning 'Land of the Mizos', it sits perched on the ridges of hills, a sentinel of culture and calm.

defining_themes.title: Blue Mountains
defining_themes.description: Phawngpui (Blue Mountain) is the highest peak.

defining_themes.title: Tlawmngaihna
defining_themes.description: The Mizo code of ethics and self-sacrifice.

contributions.title: High Literacy
contributions.description: One of the highest literacy rates in India.

ways_to_experience.title: Trekking
ways_to_experience.description: Explore the Blue Mountain National Park.

name: Tripura
funFacts: Home to the Neermahal, the only lake palace in Northeast India.
Unakoti features rock carvings of Shiva.

description_section.title: Welcome to Tripura
description_section.content: A royal history carved in stone and built on water. Tripura blends tribal culture with Bengali heritage.

land_and_memory.title: Land & Memory
land_and_memory.content: The Ujjayanta Palace stands as a witness to the Manikya dynasty, while Unakoti whispers legends carved in rock.

name: Sikkim
funFacts: Home to Kanchenjunga, the third highest peak in the world.

description_section.title: Welcome to Sikkim
description_section.content: A Himalayan paradise where nature is revered and protected. Sikkim offers majestic views of Kanchenjunga and spiritual peace.

land_and_memory.title: Land & Memory
land_and_memory.content: Under the watchful gaze of Khangchendzonga, the guardian deity, Sikkim remains a sanctuary of peace and organic living.

ways_to_experience.title: Yak Safari
ways_to_experience.description: Ride a yak near Tsomgo Lake.
